thread.title: Heena Sidhu wins gold, Shweta Singh bags silver on final day of Asian shooting meet
thread.title_full: Heena Sidhu wins gold, Shweta Singh bags silver on final day of Asian shooting meet

title: Heena Sidhu wins gold, Shweta Singh bags silver on final day of Asian shooting meet
text:
Heena Sidhu wins gold, Shweta Singh bags silver on final day of Asian shooting meet Updated: Wednesday, September 30, 2015, 23:50 [IST] Facebook Twitter Google+ Comments Mail 
New Delhi, Sep 30: Heena Sidhu and Shweta Singh signed off the Indian campaign on a high note by clinching the gold and silver , respectively, on the final day of the Asian Air Gun Championships here on Wednesday. 
It was a close fight between the two Indians at the Dr Karni Singh Shooting Range with Heena finishing on the top of the podium with a total of 197.8 in the final round. 
Shweta followed closely behind with 197, a considerable distance ahead of Seon Kim of South Korea who took bronze with a total score of 175.8. 
Yashaswini Deswal, the third Indian in the fray, finished fourth with a score of 155.3. 
India finished the event with a medal haul of two gold, two silver and two bronze medals. 
IANS
